answers.answer: Have you tried vitamin b6. That can help nausea. Also, I've heard that vomiting can be from foods that are actually an irritant/allergen  and we're far more sensitive durning pregnancy. Stick to simple, unprocessed foods if you're not already - vegetables, especially green leafy ones (fruits that are not too acidic). Keep away from wheat and corn based grains...opt for oats ant rice instead. Might help...certainly won't harm to try
I wonder if your stomach would tolerate smoothies better since they're easier to digest? You might think about taking probiotics, some prenatal even include them.

question: I have had nausea and vomiting off and on thru my entire pregnancy. Today is one of the worst. I cant seem to keep anything down. Im hungry constantly but even the thought of eating makes me want to throw up. This is so frustrating! I have gestational diabetes so i have to eat but i doubt it does me or her any good when i just throw everything right back up :(
title: not a question just venting
